sect1.title: Project overview
sect1.para: The aim of this project is to build a hydrogen powered lead acid battery charger. It is based on the Arduino, H2MDK fuel cell shield and the XP Power 30W dc/dc converter. We will use a P channel mosfet to regulate the current supplied by the fuel cell to a safe limit. The mosfet will be controlled by a PWM output of the Arduino.

itemizedlist.listitem: 30W 15V output dc/dc converter that will accept input voltage as low as 9V, for example the XP Power 30W dc/dc converter
P channel mosfet that can handle 3A, for example FQP8P10
Up to a 7AH lead acid battery

sect2.title: H2MDK library
sect2.para: Make sure you've got the latest version of the H2MDK Arduino library installed by downloading and unzipping into your sketchbook/libraries folder.
Start the Arduino IDE and have a look at the file->examples->H2MDK->batteryCharger sketch
